title: Sequoia & Kings Canyon National Parks: Potwisha Campground
body: Potwisha Campground        Potwisha campground NPS Photo   Â    Potwisha Campground is located 4 miles (6.5 km) from the Sequoia National Park entrance. Situated along the Middle Fork of the Kaweah River under an open stand of oaks, the campground is hot in the summer and usually snow-free in the winter.      Region   Foothills area in Sequoia     Elevation   2,100 ft. (640 m)     Open   All year     Reservations   Some sites available for reservation year round. All sites available for reservation 5/4/2016 - 9/27/2016. See below for reservation info.    Fee  $22/night     Number of sites   42     RV/Trailer length   Varies     Hookups   None    Generator hours Use them 9 a.m. - 9 p.m. only!    Pets   Permitted (more about pet regulations)     Dump station   Yes     Groceries   Three Rivers     Showers   No     Accessibility   Site #40 is suitable for wheelchairs     Ranger Programs   Offered in the summer at the campground amphitheater     Phone   Yes     Restrooms   Flush     Food storage   Large food locker - 47"W x 33"D x 28"H      You are required to store food properly in order to protect bears. Learn more about bears and food storage in the parks. You may make reservations starting 6 months in advance of the date you would like to camp. For example, reservations for July 4 can be made starting January 4. Reservations: Go online to Recreation.gov or call toll free: 877-444-6777 (TDD 877-833-6777) from 10 a.m. - midnight EST March 1 through October 31, or 10 a.m. - 10 p.m. EST November 1 through February. Customer Service: 888-448-1474. Download the Potwisha campground map for a larger, printable image. (PDF)
